definitions: A synthetic organic compound with the formula CH3(CH2)11OSO3Na. It is an anionic surfactant used in many cleaning and hygiene products.
A common component in detergents, shampoos, and toothpastes, known for its ability to create lather and remove oils.
A chemical compound often used in molecular biology for protein denaturation and in electrophoresis.
examples: Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate is a key ingredient in many household cleaners.
Researchers use Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate to prepare samples for gel electrophoresis.
Some people prefer products without Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate due to skin sensitivity.
